docs.snippet: Is such a thing even possible? Farhad Manjoo, despite his love of social media, set out to avoid news about the president. It was not easy.

headline.print_headline: Daily Report: In Search of Trump-Free News Zones
headline.main: Daily Report: In Search of Trump-Free News Zones

docs.snippet: To curb the harassment and denigration of servicewomen, male and female recruits should go through boot camp together.

headline.main: More Than Just Marines Behaving Badly

docs.snippet: Analysts have grown leery of slowing user growth experienced last year by the company, whose shares tumbled 12 percent Monday and 8 percent in early trading Tuesday.

docs.snippet: City, county, law enforcement and emergency response officials took to social media over the course of several hours to warn people across the country of the disruption.

docs.snippet: Alexei Navalny, a charismatic critic of Russian President Vladimir V. Putin, was doused with a green liquid but gave the attack a positive spin.

docs.snippet: As the Marine Corps commissions a task force on a nude photo sharing scandal, veterans have been gathering intelligence and striking back online.

docs.snippet: The parent company of Snapchat called itself a “camera company” in its initial public offering filed on Thursday. Maybe investors should treat it that way.

docs.snippet: Google offers a few tools to organize your mail as it arrives in your in box so you can find the most important messages more easily.
